holidays.name: Falling Needles Family Fest
holidays.description: A quirky day dedicated to clearing out your Christmas tree needles before the new year cleanses your holiday space.
holidays.origin: Emerging from families frustrated by the lingering pine needles post-Christmas, this informal fest encourages a collective sweep of fallen needles to embrace fresh starts.
holidays.funFact: Some families hold competitions on who can collect the most needles without triggering a sneeze attack!

holidays.name: Bicarbonate of Soda Day
holidays.description: An ode to the humble baking soda—nature’s multitasker—from deodorizing to baking and even cleaning.
holidays.origin: Celebrated mainly by household enthusiasts and chemists who appreciate its endless uses, this day shines a light on that trusty white powder in your pantry.
holidays.funFact: Bicarbonate of soda can even extinguish small grease fires—making it a kitchen hero beyond baking.

holidays.name: Eggnog Day
holidays.description: A festive nod to the rich, creamy holiday drink loved by many during December’s cold nights.
holidays.origin: This unofficial food holiday celebrates the eggnog that’s been a holiday staple since the 1700s, a blend of eggs, milk, sugar, and often a splash of spirit.
holidays.funFact: Eggnog was traditionally served warm and often included nutmeg, which was believed to have medicinal properties.

holidays.name: Make Up Your Mind Day
holidays.description: A whimsical reminder to decisively tackle all those lingering indecisions before the new year begins!
holidays.origin: Origin unclear, but perfectly timed at the year's end to encourage commitment in choices large and small.
holidays.funFact: People sometimes use this day to finalize New Year's resolutions, hoping that decisiveness will carry through the next year.
